thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: Moody’s CEO Embraces New Businesses, But Bond Ratings as Dominant as Ever

author: Gunjan Banerji
title: Moody’s CEO Embraces New Businesses, But Bond Ratings as Dominant as Ever
text:
A decade after the financial crisis, The Wall Street Journal has checked in on dozens of the bankers, government officials, chief executives, hedge-fund managers and others who left a mark on that period to find out what they are doing now. Today, we spotlight former Merrill Lynch banker Christopher Ricciardi and Moody’s CEO Raymond McDaniel.
Moody’s Corp. Chief Executive Raymond McDaniel Jr. has been guiding the credit ratings firm into new opportunities. But after weathering criticism for giving lofty ratings to debt...
